sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: Protocol Form
sci:arg.sci:help: The path to a protocol that will render an HTML user interface for this protocol. This optional parameter is used by Web Port to provide a custom user interface for a protocol.

sci:arg.name: __PoolID
sci:arg.sci:help:
__PoolID is a case insensitive string that can optionally be set to optimize the speed of execution for quick running protocols. Multiple protocols with the same value for __PoolID can share expensive resources such as database connections, Java VMs, memory, etc. reducing the execution time by 1 to 2 seconds per run. This can give a large speed improvement to protocols that run in a few seconds such as web applications and interactive reports. Longer running protocols will not see much benefit. Generally, it is a good idea to use the same __PoolID for all protocols within a single application such as an interactive report since many of the components, databases, and data structures will be similar.

__PoolID can also be specified by the client when the protocol is launched. If __PoolID is specified both as a parameter by the client and as a parameter stored within the protocol, the client's value overrides the stored value.

To disable pooling entirely for this particular protocol, set __PoolID to <Disable>

sci:arg.name: Http Cookie Handling
sci:arg.sci:help:
Http Cookie Handling provides a mechanism to control the handling of Http cookies within components that access remote resources via Http and Https. These include the HTTP Connector, Data readers such as Text Reader, XML Reader (Generic), etc., and custom Java, Perl, and .Net components that use the available APIs for accessing remote servers. By default, New Protocols will have this setting enabled and set to "Protocol Scope". This means that Http cookies obtained from a remote server within any component in the protocol or any of its subprotocols will be parsed and appropriately sent back on subsequent requests from the same component or any other component. The handling of the cookies is based on the IETF standard as specified in http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265. Setting the parameter to Disabled will prevent components from parsing and returning cookies to the remote servers.

Persistence of cookies is not supported, so scoping of Http cookies is entirely within the context of a single protocol execution.

Older protocols that do not have the Http Cookie Handling parameter will behave as though it had been set to "Disabled". To enable cookie handling in these protocols, copy this parameter from a New Protocol to the older protocol and set the parameter as desired.

sci:arg.name: Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: The Run On Grid parameter tells the server to run the protocol on the grid engine if SES is configured to run with grid integration.

sci:arg.name: Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: The Queue Name allows you to specify the name of the queue on the grid engine to submit the job to. Leave blank to specify the default queue.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Grid Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Grid Options allows you to specify options to the grid engine submit command. Leave blank to specify the default options.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Run On Grid');

sci:arg.sci:help: The contents of a delimited text file. This is a way to include a delimited text file in a protocol without sending an additional file.

sci:arg.name: Delimiter
sci:arg.sci:help:

sci:arg.name: MultipleValueDelimiter
sci:arg.sci:help: The delimiter to use between multiple values contained in a single property. If the multiple value delimited exists in any of the input strings in any property, they are separated into an array of values. If "None", values are never separated into multiple values.

sci:arg.name: HasColumnNames
sci:arg.sci:help: When True, property names are taken from the first line of data in the file. When False, properties are named Column1,Column2, etc.

sci:arg.name: Parameter to Map
sci:arg.sci:help: The name of a parameter on the target protocol that this component's value should be mapped to.

sci:arg.name: Text
sci:arg.sci:help: The text, or property containing the text, to be shown as an entry in the list box.

sci:arg.name: Value
sci:arg.sci:help:
The value that will be submitted for each item in the list. If not specified, the value of Text will be submitted.

Notes:

  • When working with array data in PilotScript expressions use the special property "CurrentArrayIndex" to access the array element that is currently being processed. For example, to multiply the values of the array property, "Foo", by 2, use:

    Foo[CurrentArrayIndex] * 2

    If you omit [CurrentArrayIndex], only the first element of the array will be used.

    If the PilotScript expression is just a property name, you do not need to use "CurrentArrayIndex".

  • Due to inconsistent input value attribute handling by various browsers, it is recommended that the Value parameter not include leading or trailing whitespace. Depending on the browser, this whitespace may be omitted when the form is submitted. A possible workaround is to flank the entire value with a special character that can then be stripped when the input value is processed in the work protocol.

sci:arg.name: Allow Multiple Selections
sci:arg.sci:help: If true, multiple selections can be made in the list box. Otherwise, only one entry can be selected.

sci:arg.name: Selected
sci:arg.sci:help:
An optional PilotScript expression evaluating to True or False that determines if the current entry is pre-selected in the list box. For example, if the Text parameter is set to a property 'MyPet' and you want to have a value 'Cat' selected, then do the following:

MyPet eq 'Cat';

If you want the last item in a single selection list box to be pre-selected, simply enter True.

Notes:

  • When working with array data in PilotScript expressions use the special property "CurrentArrayIndex" to access the array element that is currently being processed. For example, to multiply the values of the array property, "Foo", by 2, use:

    Foo[CurrentArrayIndex] * 2

    If you omit [CurrentArrayIndex], only the first element of the array will be used.

    If the PilotScript expression is just a property name, you do not need to use "CurrentArrayIndex".

sci:arg.name: Searchable
sci:arg.sci:help: Make the list box searchable?
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Allow Multiple Selections" to False'); not Parameter('Allow Multiple Selections');

sci:arg.name: Width
sci:arg.sci:help: Width of the list box including its label (if present), in columns. Full screen is 16 columns. Leave blank to auto-size up to the widest available space.

sci:arg.name: Label Location
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set a Label.'); Parameter('Label') ne '';

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: DeclareLocal
sci:arg.sci:help:
Lists a set of properties (without the @) to create on the global property list for this subprotocol. Such properties can only be accessed within the scope of this subprotocol and its descendent subprotocols.

Any global property not declared in this way is created on the top level global property list and is accessible from all protocols, but may collide with another property of the same name.

Scoping global properties to the subprotocol where they are used is highly recommended.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion
sci:arg.sci:help:
When RunToCompletion is set to "True - For Each Data Record", the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each individual data record it processes.

When set to "True - For Each Category", the data records are divided into categories based on the value of the Categorize Using parameter and then the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each category of data records. When used in conjunction with Parallel Processing Options, each category of data records will be sent to the remote server as part of one single batch.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion Categorize Using
sci:arg.sci:help: Required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category, this parameter specifies the property or properties used to define the categories.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To Enable, Set RunToCompletion to True - For Each Category'); Parameter('RunToCompletion') eq 'True - For Each Category';

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options
sci:arg.sci:help:
When set to True, this set of options allow the subprotocol to execute in parallel on one or more independent Pipeline Pilot servers, running local or remote. Additional parameters control the number of data records to send in each process batch, the list of Pipeline Pilot servers to use, the number of protocol processes that can be executed on each server, and whether to preserve the order of the processed data records.

Use this option judiciously, since it will not increase throughput in all circumstances. In general, it will yield improved performance when the parallelization benefits outweigh the data transfer overhead for the specified batch size. As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Preserve Order
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to preserve the order of the data as it enters and leaves the remote subprotocol.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Constant GUID
sci:arg.sci:help:
Override an automatically set GUID inside the component with this value.

If set, HTML element(s) will have their IDs set using this value instead of a randomly generated one.

Spaces or special characters are not allowed, only alphanumeric. The ID is case-sensitive.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails(ParameterName() . ' must be alphanumeric. Spaces or special characters are not allowed.'); numValues(rMatch(Parameter(), '[^a-zA-Z0-9]+', 'ig')) == 0;

sci:arg.name: Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup displays additional information in a temporary message.

sci:arg.name: Popup Content
sci:arg.sci:help: Popup content. (HTML is allowed).

sci:arg.name: Basic Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can provide basic or extended formatting.

sci:arg.name: Popup Appearance
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set Basic Popup to False'); not Parameter('Basic Popup');

sci:arg.name: Popup Width
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can be wide or very wide to allow for longer content.

sci:arg.name: Fluid Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A fluid popup will take up the entire width of its container.

sci:arg.name: Popup Size
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can vary in font size.

sci:arg.name: Flowing Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have no maximum width and continue to flow to fit its content.

sci:arg.name: Inverted Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have its colors inverted.

sci:arg.name: Show On
sci:arg.sci:help: When to show the popup. Hover (mouseover), click, focus (when a form element such as a text box is in focus).

sci:arg.name: Full Text Search
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifying "exact" will force the exact search to be matched somewhere in the string, even in the middle of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge.

Specifying "true" will use a fuzzy full text search anywhere in the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge and bear and mybear and myboar.

Specifying "false" will force an exact search only starting at the beginning of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge but not mybarge and not boar.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Searchable" to True'); Parameter('Searchable');

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Used to select one or more items from a list, to be passed to the work protocol. Single or multi-select can be set. If multiple values are selected, they are passed as an array.
This component accepts both regular data records and array data. If multiple records with array data are received, a list box for each data record will be created.
You can set the number of rows to be displayed. If the number of rows is less than the number of values to be displayed, then a vertical scroll bar is automatically added. To create a drop-down list, set the number of rows to be displayed to 1.
Records passing out of any unconnected pass ports of components inside the subprotocol
Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - For Each Data Record", the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each individual data record it processes.

When set to "True - For Each Category", the data records are divided into categories based on the value of the Categorize Using parameter and then the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each category of data records. When used in conjunction with Parallel Processing Options, each category of data records will be sent to the remote server as part of one single batch.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion Categorize Using
sci:arg.sci:help: Required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category, this parameter specifies the property or properties used to define the categories.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To Enable, Set RunToCompletion to True - For Each Category'); Parameter('RunToCompletion') eq 'True - For Each Category';

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options
sci:arg.sci:help:
When set to True, this set of options allow the subprotocol to execute in parallel on one or more independent Pipeline Pilot servers, running local or remote. Additional parameters control the number of data records to send in each process batch, the list of Pipeline Pilot servers to use, the number of protocol processes that can be executed on each server, and whether to preserve the order of the processed data records.

Use this option judiciously, since it will not increase throughput in all circumstances. In general, it will yield improved performance when the parallelization benefits outweigh the data transfer overhead for the specified batch size. As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Grid Options
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Grid Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Use this to specify grid engine specific command line parameters to the job submission command. Leave blank to use defaults.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Preserve Order
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to preserve the order of the data as it enters and leaves the remote subprotocol.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Rows are groups of columns which are aligned horizontally.

Rows can either be explicit, marked with an additional row element, or implicit, automatically occurring when no more space is left in a previous row.

Most grids do not need to specify rows. Content will automatically flow to the next row when all the grid columns are taken in the current row.

After each group of columns vertical spacing is added to separate each group of columns, creating vertical rhythm.

Pipe the output of one or more Row components into a Grid component.

Semantic's default theme uses 16 columns.
Records passing out of any unconnected pass ports of components inside the subprotocol
Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

sci:arg.name: Vertically Aligned
sci:arg.sci:help: A grid can optionaly specify how its content is aligned vertically. The default alignment of content is at the top of a grid cell.

sci:arg.name: Centered
sci:arg.sci:help: If a row does not take up all sixteen grid columns, you can use a centered variation to center the column contents inside the grid.

sci:arg.name: Container
sci:arg.sci:help:
Grids are fluid and will automatically flow in size to take the maximum available width, even if the screen is very wide.

Containers are elements designed to limit page content to a reasonable maximum width for display based on the size of the user's screen.

Using a grid container is the best way to include top-level page content inside a grid.

sci:arg.name: Divided
sci:arg.sci:help: A grid can have dividers between its columns. Requires Rows.

sci:arg.name: Vertically Divided
sci:arg.sci:help: A grid can have dividers between its rows. Requires Rows.

sci:arg.name: Celled
sci:arg.sci:help: A grid can have rows divided into cells. Requires Rows.

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: DeclareLocal
sci:arg.sci:help:
Lists a set of properties (without the @) to create on the global property list for this subprotocol. Such properties can only be accessed within the scope of this subprotocol and its descendent subprotocols.

Any global property not declared in this way is created on the top level global property list and is accessible from all protocols, but may collide with another property of the same name.

Scoping global properties to the subprotocol where they are used is highly recommended.
sci:arg.sci:value: centered_, container_, divided_, vdivided_, celled_, aligned_

sci:arg.name: Advanced Options
sci:arg.sci:help: Advanced Options

sci:arg.name: Theme
sci:arg.sci:help:
Choose a visual theme for the content.

  • 2.2.1: released 06/2016
  • Default (v 2.1.8): released 02/2016
Semantic UI release history with detailed notes: https://github.com/Semantic-Org/Semantic-UI/releases

When the component collection is updated with a new Semantic UI release, the components in unmodified existing protocols will continue to point to a set release version. You can also point this parameter to a newer release if you wish by right-clicking the component and Replace with Latest Version then selecting a newer semantic theme release.

To add a new custom theme (e.g. developed in-house): do not change this component. Just add a new subfolder to the ScitegicRoot\apps\saber\semantic\dataroot\data\assets\semantic\ file folder. The subfolder should contain a compiled customized copy of the Semantic UI distribution. The name of the subfolder should be alphanumeric and it cannot contain spaces or special characters.

sci:arg.name: Include Format and Position CSS
sci:arg.sci:help: If set to True, all native Pipeline Pilot format and position settings will be included in the output document. Otherwise all native Pipeline Pilot formatting will be ignored.

sci:arg.name: Add Page Margins
sci:arg.sci:help: When not using native Scitegic CSS, add page margins. This will add small margins on each side of the page. Scitegic styles already include this.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: not Parameter('Include Format and Position CSS');

sci:arg.name: Animate Link Underlines
sci:arg.sci:help: When hovering over a link, the link's underline is revealed by animating it out from the center.

sci:arg.name: Web Browser
sci:arg.sci:help:
This parameter is only relevant when running the protocol in the Pipeline Pilot Professional Client. When running the protocol from a web hyperlink or a URL the value of this parameter is ignored.

The value specifies which web browser to open on your desktop to view the report.

sci:arg.name: Output Mode
sci:arg.sci:help:
Allows some alternative formatting and position settings to be used that may cause the HTML report output to behave and look more like the HTML generated with previous versions of Pipeline Pilot. This parameter is intended to be set on writers in protocols developed with previous versions of Pipeline Pilot where the output looks or behaves differently when run with the current version.

Always use the value of "Default" for new protocols or protocols under active development. The latest Reporting components may not behave correctly in HTML reports written with a non-default mode.

When set to "Pipeline Pilot 7.5", this parameter rolls back some of the improvements made in the name of standards compliance and formatting consistency, including:

  • The report will not include the HTML 4.01 Doctype declaration, which will cause Internet Explorer to render the report using quirks mode.
  • Position rules will not be strictly enforced, so Internet Explorer 6 will render borders and padding outside the specified width.
  • Horizontal alignment of block objects will not be supported, so you will not be able to, for example, center-align a table.
  • The page margins will not be set.

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help: Lists the set of temporary files which will be converted by the network to true temporary file names

sci:arg.name: DeclareLocal
sci:arg.sci:help: Lists a set of properties (without the @) to be created on the property list for this protocol. Other properties are created on the global property list and so are accessible from all protocols.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion
sci:arg.sci:help: When the network is run, whether we process once or until done for each process call

sci:arg.name: Accept Bootstrap
sci:arg.sci:help: Allow the use of Web Design (Bootstrap) collection components with the Semantic UI viewer? Generally speaking, this parameter should always be set to False to prevent the inadvertent mixing of the two frameworks.

sci:arg.name: Set IE Compatibility
sci:arg.sci:help:
When this flag is set to True (default), IE compatibility in the report is set to IE 10 (the minimum support level for Pipeline Pilot). For most users of IE, this should provide a stable environment to view Pipeline Pilot reports.

Switch off this setting, if necessary, to allow Internet Explorer to display content in the highest mode available. This is only required for users who view the report in Internet Explorer 11 or above and who need to enable facilities not available in IE 10 mode, such as WebGL and some HTML5/CSS features.

Note that even if you are viewing the report in another browser, other users may subsequently run the protocol or view the report in Internet Explorer, and so you may still need to set this IE Compatibility setting - but only in the rare case that your report requires something beyond the default IE 10 compatibility.

sci:arg.name: Delimiter
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifies the character that separates fields. Options include:
- FigureOut: Determines the type automatically. - Tab: For tab-delimited fields. - Space: For space-delimited fields. - Comma: For comma-delimited fields. - Colon: For colon-delimited fields. - Semicolon: For semicolon-delimited fields.

sci:arg.name: MultipleValueDelimiter
sci:arg.sci:help: The delimiter to use between multiple values contained in a single property. If the multiple value delimited exists in any of the input strings in any property, they are separated into an array of values. If "None", values are never separated into multiple values.

sci:arg.name: Text
sci:arg.sci:help: The text, or property containing the text, to be shown as an entry in the list box.

sci:arg.name: Value
sci:arg.sci:help:
The value that will be submitted for each item in the list. If not specified, the value of Text will be submitted.

Notes:

  • When working with array data in PilotScript expressions use the special property "CurrentArrayIndex" to access the array element that is currently being processed. For example, to multiply the values of the array property, "Foo", by 2, use:

    Foo[CurrentArrayIndex] * 2

    If you omit [CurrentArrayIndex], only the first element of the array will be used.

    If the PilotScript expression is just a property name, you do not need to use "CurrentArrayIndex".

  • Due to inconsistent input value attribute handling by various browsers, it is recommended that the Value parameter not include leading or trailing whitespace. Depending on the browser, this whitespace may be omitted when the form is submitted. A possible workaround is to flank the entire value with a special character that can then be stripped when the input value is processed in the work protocol.

sci:arg.name: Allow Multiple Selections
sci:arg.sci:help: If true, multiple selections can be made in the list box. Otherwise, only one entry can be selected.

sci:arg.name: Selected
sci:arg.sci:help:
An optional PilotScript expression evaluating to True or False that determines if the current entry is pre-selected in the list box. For example, if the Text parameter is set to a property 'MyPet' and you want to have a value 'Cat' selected, then do the following:

MyPet eq 'Cat';

If you want the last item in a single selection list box to be pre-selected, simply enter True.

Notes:

  • When working with array data in PilotScript expressions use the special property "CurrentArrayIndex" to access the array element that is currently being processed. For example, to multiply the values of the array property, "Foo", by 2, use:

    Foo[CurrentArrayIndex] * 2

    If you omit [CurrentArrayIndex], only the first element of the array will be used.

    If the PilotScript expression is just a property name, you do not need to use "CurrentArrayIndex".

sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Allow Multiple Selections" to False'); not Parameter('Allow Multiple Selections');

sci:arg.sci:help: Width of the list box including its label (if present), in columns. Full screen is 16 columns. Leave blank to auto-size up to the widest available space.

Lists a set of properties (without the @) to create on the global property list for this subprotocol. Such properties can only be accessed within the scope of this subprotocol and its descendent subprotocols.

Any global property not declared in this way is created on the top level global property list and is accessible from all protocols, but may collide with another property of the same name.

Scoping global properties to the subprotocol where they are used is highly recommended.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion
sci:arg.sci:help:
When RunToCompletion is set to "True - For Each Data Record", the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each individual data record it processes.

When set to "True - For Each Category", the data records are divided into categories based on the value of the Categorize Using parameter and then the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each category of data records. When used in conjunction with Parallel Processing Options, each category of data records will be sent to the remote server as part of one single batch.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion Categorize Using
sci:arg.sci:help: Required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category, this parameter specifies the property or properties used to define the categories.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To Enable, Set RunToCompletion to True - For Each Category'); Parameter('RunToCompletion') eq 'True - For Each Category';

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options
sci:arg.sci:help:
When set to True, this set of options allow the subprotocol to execute in parallel on one or more independent Pipeline Pilot servers, running local or remote. Additional parameters control the number of data records to send in each process batch, the list of Pipeline Pilot servers to use, the number of protocol processes that can be executed on each server, and whether to preserve the order of the processed data records.

Use this option judiciously, since it will not increase throughput in all circumstances. In general, it will yield improved performance when the parallelization benefits outweigh the data transfer overhead for the specified batch size. As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Preserve Order
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to preserve the order of the data as it enters and leaves the remote subprotocol.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Constant GUID
sci:arg.sci:help:
Override an automatically set GUID inside the component with this value.

If set, HTML element(s) will have their IDs set using this value instead of a randomly generated one.

Spaces or special characters are not allowed, only alphanumeric. The ID is case-sensitive.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails(ParameterName() . ' must be alphanumeric. Spaces or special characters are not allowed.'); numValues(rMatch(Parameter(), '[^a-zA-Z0-9]+', 'ig')) == 0;

sci:arg.name: Popup Size
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can vary in font size.

sci:arg.name: Flowing Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have no maximum width and continue to flow to fit its content.

sci:arg.name: Inverted Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have its colors inverted.

sci:arg.name: Show On
sci:arg.sci:help: When to show the popup. Hover (mouseover), click, focus (when a form element such as a text box is in focus).

sci:arg.name: Full Text Search
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifying "exact" will force the exact search to be matched somewhere in the string, even in the middle of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge.

Specifying "true" will use a fuzzy full text search anywhere in the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge and bear and mybear and myboar.

Specifying "false" will force an exact search only starting at the beginning of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge but not mybarge and not boar.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Searchable" to True'); Parameter('Searchable');

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Used to select one or more items from a list, to be passed to the work protocol. Single or multi-select can be set. If multiple values are selected, they are passed as an array.
This component accepts both regular data records and array data. If multiple records with array data are received, a list box for each data record will be created.
You can set the number of rows to be displayed. If the number of rows is less than the number of values to be displayed, then a vertical scroll bar is automatically added. To create a drop-down list, set the number of rows to be displayed to 1.

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Rows are groups of columns which are aligned horizontally.

Rows can either be explicit, marked with an additional row element, or implicit, automatically occurring when no more space is left in a previous row.

Most grids do not need to specify rows. Content will automatically flow to the next row when all the grid columns are taken in the current row.

After each group of columns vertical spacing is added to separate each group of columns, creating vertical rhythm.

Pipe the output of one or more Row components into a Grid component.

Semantic's default theme uses 16 columns.

Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

sci:arg.sci:help: The contents of a delimited text file. This is a way to include a delimited text file in a protocol without sending an additional file.

sci:arg.name: Delimiter
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifies the character that separates fields. Options include:
- FigureOut: Determines the type automatically. - Tab: For tab-delimited fields. - Space: For space-delimited fields. - Comma: For comma-delimited fields. - Colon: For colon-delimited fields. - Semicolon: For semicolon-delimited fields.

sci:arg.name: MultipleValueDelimiter
sci:arg.sci:help: The delimiter to use between multiple values contained in a single property. If the multiple value delimited exists in any of the input strings in any property, they are separated into an array of values. If "None", values are never separated into multiple values.

sci:arg.name: HasColumnNames
sci:arg.sci:help: When True, property names are taken from the first line of data in the file. When False, properties are named Column1,Column2, etc.

This can be useful when you wish to send someone an example with the data contained with the protocol in a readable format. Just open the delimited file with a text viewer such as Notepad, copy the contents, and paste it into the DelimitedText parameter. Note that this component will be deprecated in the future -- you should use the right-click context Initialize Using option Provided Content on the Source parameter of the Delimited Text Reader.

sci:arg.name: Parameter to Map
sci:arg.sci:help: The name of a parameter on the target protocol that this component's value should be mapped to.

sci:arg.name: Text
sci:arg.sci:help: The text, or property containing the text, to be shown as an entry in the list box.

sci:arg.name: Value
sci:arg.sci:help:
The value that will be submitted for each item in the list. If not specified, the value of Text will be submitted.

Notes:

  • When working with array data in PilotScript expressions use the special property "CurrentArrayIndex" to access the array element that is currently being processed. For example, to multiply the values of the array property, "Foo", by 2, use:

    Foo[CurrentArrayIndex] * 2

    If you omit [CurrentArrayIndex], only the first element of the array will be used.

    If the PilotScript expression is just a property name, you do not need to use "CurrentArrayIndex".

  • Due to inconsistent input value attribute handling by various browsers, it is recommended that the Value parameter not include leading or trailing whitespace. Depending on the browser, this whitespace may be omitted when the form is submitted. A possible workaround is to flank the entire value with a special character that can then be stripped when the input value is processed in the work protocol.

sci:arg.name: Allow Multiple Selections
sci:arg.sci:help: If true, multiple selections can be made in the list box. Otherwise, only one entry can be selected.

sci:arg.name: Selected
sci:arg.sci:help:
An optional PilotScript expression evaluating to True or False that determines if the current entry is pre-selected in the list box. For example, if the Text parameter is set to a property 'MyPet' and you want to have a value 'Cat' selected, then do the following:

MyPet eq 'Cat';

If you want the last item in a single selection list box to be pre-selected, simply enter True.

Notes:

  • When working with array data in PilotScript expressions use the special property "CurrentArrayIndex" to access the array element that is currently being processed. For example, to multiply the values of the array property, "Foo", by 2, use:

    Foo[CurrentArrayIndex] * 2

    If you omit [CurrentArrayIndex], only the first element of the array will be used.

    If the PilotScript expression is just a property name, you do not need to use "CurrentArrayIndex".

sci:arg.name: Searchable
sci:arg.sci:help: Make the list box searchable?
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Allow Multiple Selections" to False'); not Parameter('Allow Multiple Selections');

sci:arg.name: Width
sci:arg.sci:help: Width of the list box including its label (if present), in columns. Full screen is 16 columns. Leave blank to auto-size up to the widest available space.

sci:arg.name: Label Location
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set a Label.'); Parameter('Label') ne '';

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: DeclareLocal
sci:arg.sci:help:
Lists a set of properties (without the @) to create on the global property list for this subprotocol. Such properties can only be accessed within the scope of this subprotocol and its descendent subprotocols.

Any global property not declared in this way is created on the top level global property list and is accessible from all protocols, but may collide with another property of the same name.

Scoping global properties to the subprotocol where they are used is highly recommended.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion
sci:arg.sci:help:
When RunToCompletion is set to "True - For Each Data Record", the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each individual data record it processes.

When set to "True - For Each Category", the data records are divided into categories based on the value of the Categorize Using parameter and then the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each category of data records. When used in conjunction with Parallel Processing Options, each category of data records will be sent to the remote server as part of one single batch.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion Categorize Using
sci:arg.sci:help: Required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category, this parameter specifies the property or properties used to define the categories.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To Enable, Set RunToCompletion to True - For Each Category'); Parameter('RunToCompletion') eq 'True - For Each Category';

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options
sci:arg.sci:help:
When set to True, this set of options allow the subprotocol to execute in parallel on one or more independent Pipeline Pilot servers, running local or remote. Additional parameters control the number of data records to send in each process batch, the list of Pipeline Pilot servers to use, the number of protocol processes that can be executed on each server, and whether to preserve the order of the processed data records.

Use this option judiciously, since it will not increase throughput in all circumstances. In general, it will yield improved performance when the parallelization benefits outweigh the data transfer overhead for the specified batch size. As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Preserve Order
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to preserve the order of the data as it enters and leaves the remote subprotocol.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Constant GUID
sci:arg.sci:help:
Override an automatically set GUID inside the component with this value.

If set, HTML element(s) will have their IDs set using this value instead of a randomly generated one.

Spaces or special characters are not allowed, only alphanumeric. The ID is case-sensitive.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails(ParameterName() . ' must be alphanumeric. Spaces or special characters are not allowed.'); numValues(rMatch(Parameter(), '[^a-zA-Z0-9]+', 'ig')) == 0;

sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup displays additional information in a temporary message.

sci:arg.name: Popup Content
sci:arg.sci:help: Popup content. (HTML is allowed).

sci:arg.name: Basic Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can provide basic or extended formatting.

sci:arg.name: Popup Appearance
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set Basic Popup to False'); not Parameter('Basic Popup');

sci:arg.name: Popup Width
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can be wide or very wide to allow for longer content.

sci:arg.name: Fluid Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A fluid popup will take up the entire width of its container.

sci:arg.name: Popup Size
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can vary in font size.

sci:arg.name: Flowing Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have no maximum width and continue to flow to fit its content.

sci:arg.name: Inverted Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have its colors inverted.

sci:arg.name: Show On
sci:arg.sci:help: When to show the popup. Hover (mouseover), click, focus (when a form element such as a text box is in focus).

sci:arg.name: Full Text Search
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifying "exact" will force the exact search to be matched somewhere in the string, even in the middle of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge.

Specifying "true" will use a fuzzy full text search anywhere in the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge and bear and mybear and myboar.

Specifying "false" will force an exact search only starting at the beginning of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge but not mybarge and not boar.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Searchable" to True'); Parameter('Searchable');

sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol AutoLayout

sci:arg.name: ComponentRevision
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Revision

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Used to select one or more items from a list, to be passed to the work protocol. Single or multi-select can be set. If multiple values are selected, they are passed as an array.
This component accepts both regular data records and array data. If multiple records with array data are received, a list box for each data record will be created.
You can set the number of rows to be displayed. If the number of rows is less than the number of values to be displayed, then a vertical scroll bar is automatically added. To create a drop-down list, set the number of rows to be displayed to 1.
Records passing out of any unconnected pass ports of components inside the subprotocol
Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

sci:arg.name: ByReference
sci:arg.sci:help: By Ref

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Rows are groups of columns which are aligned horizontally.

Rows can either be explicit, marked with an additional row element, or implicit, automatically occurring when no more space is left in a previous row.

Most grids do not need to specify rows. Content will automatically flow to the next row when all the grid columns are taken in the current row.

After each group of columns vertical spacing is added to separate each group of columns, creating vertical rhythm.

Pipe the output of one or more Row components into a Grid component.

Semantic's default theme uses 16 columns.
Records passing out of any unconnected pass ports of components inside the subprotocol
Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

sci:arg.name: DelimitedText
sci:arg.sci:help: The contents of a delimited text file. This is a way to include a delimited text file in a protocol without sending an additional file.

sci:arg.name: Delimiter
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifies the character that separates fields. Options include:
- FigureOut: Determines the type automatically. - Tab: For tab-delimited fields. - Space: For space-delimited fields. - Comma: For comma-delimited fields. - Colon: For colon-delimited fields. - Semicolon: For semicolon-delimited fields.

sci:arg.name: MultipleValueDelimiter
sci:arg.sci:help: The delimiter to use between multiple values contained in a single property. If the multiple value delimited exists in any of the input strings in any property, they are separated into an array of values. If "None", values are never separated into multiple values.

sci:arg.name: HasColumnNames
sci:arg.sci:help: When True, property names are taken from the first line of data in the file. When False, properties are named Column1,Column2, etc.

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help: Lists the set of temporary files which will be converted by the network to true temporary file names

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Read Delimited Text kept with this component as a parameter value

This can be useful when you wish to send someone an example with the data contained with the protocol in a readable format. Just open the delimited file with a text viewer such as Notepad, copy the contents, and paste it into the DelimitedText parameter. Note that this component will be deprecated in the future -- you should use the right-click context Initialize Using option Provided Content on the Source parameter of the Delimited Text Reader.

sci:arg.name: Component Path
sci:arg.sci:help: The original path within the database of this component.
sci:arg.sci:value: Components\Data Access and Manipulation\Utilities\Debug\Delimited Text Text Reader

sci:arg.name: Parameter to Map
sci:arg.sci:help: The name of a parameter on the target protocol that this component's value should be mapped to.

sci:arg.name: Text
sci:arg.sci:help: The text, or property containing the text, to be shown as an entry in the list box.

sci:arg.name: Value
sci:arg.sci:help:
The value that will be submitted for each item in the list. If not specified, the value of Text will be submitted.

Notes:

  • When working with array data in PilotScript expressions use the special property "CurrentArrayIndex" to access the array element that is currently being processed. For example, to multiply the values of the array property, "Foo", by 2, use:

    Foo[CurrentArrayIndex] * 2

    If you omit [CurrentArrayIndex], only the first element of the array will be used.

    If the PilotScript expression is just a property name, you do not need to use "CurrentArrayIndex".

  • Due to inconsistent input value attribute handling by various browsers, it is recommended that the Value parameter not include leading or trailing whitespace. Depending on the browser, this whitespace may be omitted when the form is submitted. A possible workaround is to flank the entire value with a special character that can then be stripped when the input value is processed in the work protocol.

sci:arg.name: Allow Multiple Selections
sci:arg.sci:help: If true, multiple selections can be made in the list box. Otherwise, only one entry can be selected.

sci:arg.name: Selected
sci:arg.sci:help:
An optional PilotScript expression evaluating to True or False that determines if the current entry is pre-selected in the list box. For example, if the Text parameter is set to a property 'MyPet' and you want to have a value 'Cat' selected, then do the following:

MyPet eq 'Cat';

If you want the last item in a single selection list box to be pre-selected, simply enter True.

Notes:

  • When working with array data in PilotScript expressions use the special property "CurrentArrayIndex" to access the array element that is currently being processed. For example, to multiply the values of the array property, "Foo", by 2, use:

    Foo[CurrentArrayIndex] * 2

    If you omit [CurrentArrayIndex], only the first element of the array will be used.

    If the PilotScript expression is just a property name, you do not need to use "CurrentArrayIndex".

sci:arg.name: Searchable
sci:arg.sci:help: Make the list box searchable?
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Allow Multiple Selections" to False'); not Parameter('Allow Multiple Selections');

sci:arg.name: Width
sci:arg.sci:help: Width of the list box including its label (if present), in columns. Full screen is 16 columns. Leave blank to auto-size up to the widest available space.

sci:arg.name: Label Location
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set a Label.'); Parameter('Label') ne '';

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help:
A comma delimited list of global properties, each of which will automatically hold the name of a file in the job's temporary folder, whose name is guaranteed to be unique.

For each global name, an additional global is created (with the suffix _Filename) that hold just the leaf file name of the temporary file.

sci:arg.name: DeclareLocal
sci:arg.sci:help:
Lists a set of properties (without the @) to create on the global property list for this subprotocol. Such properties can only be accessed within the scope of this subprotocol and its descendent subprotocols.

Any global property not declared in this way is created on the top level global property list and is accessible from all protocols, but may collide with another property of the same name.

Scoping global properties to the subprotocol where they are used is highly recommended.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion
sci:arg.sci:help:
When RunToCompletion is set to "True - For Each Data Record", the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each individual data record it processes.

When set to "True - For Each Category", the data records are divided into categories based on the value of the Categorize Using parameter and then the subprotocol is re-initialized and executed in its entirety for each category of data records. When used in conjunction with Parallel Processing Options, each category of data records will be sent to the remote server as part of one single batch.

sci:arg.name: RunToCompletion Categorize Using
sci:arg.sci:help: Required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category, this parameter specifies the property or properties used to define the categories.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required when RunToCompletion is set to True - For Each Category'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To Enable, Set RunToCompletion to True - For Each Category'); Parameter('RunToCompletion') eq 'True - For Each Category';

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options
sci:arg.sci:help:
When set to True, this set of options allow the subprotocol to execute in parallel on one or more independent Pipeline Pilot servers, running local or remote. Additional parameters control the number of data records to send in each process batch, the list of Pipeline Pilot servers to use, the number of protocol processes that can be executed on each server, and whether to preserve the order of the processed data records.

Use this option judiciously, since it will not increase throughput in all circumstances. In general, it will yield improved performance when the parallelization benefits outweigh the data transfer overhead for the specified batch size. As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Preserve Order
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to preserve the order of the data as it enters and leaves the remote subprotocol.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Constant GUID
sci:arg.sci:help:
Override an automatically set GUID inside the component with this value.

If set, HTML element(s) will have their IDs set using this value instead of a randomly generated one.

Spaces or special characters are not allowed, only alphanumeric. The ID is case-sensitive.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails(ParameterName() . ' must be alphanumeric. Spaces or special characters are not allowed.'); numValues(rMatch(Parameter(), '[^a-zA-Z0-9]+', 'ig')) == 0;

sci:arg.name: ComponentAttributes
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Attributes

sci:arg.name: Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup displays additional information in a temporary message.

sci:arg.name: Popup Content
sci:arg.sci:help: Popup content. (HTML is allowed).

sci:arg.name: Basic Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can provide basic or extended formatting.

sci:arg.name: Popup Appearance
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set Basic Popup to False'); not Parameter('Basic Popup');

sci:arg.name: Popup Width
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can be wide or very wide to allow for longer content.

sci:arg.name: Fluid Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A fluid popup will take up the entire width of its container.

sci:arg.name: Popup Size
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can vary in font size.

sci:arg.name: Flowing Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have no maximum width and continue to flow to fit its content.

sci:arg.name: Inverted Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have its colors inverted.

sci:arg.name: Show On
sci:arg.sci:help: When to show the popup. Hover (mouseover), click, focus (when a form element such as a text box is in focus).

sci:arg.name: Full Text Search
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifying "exact" will force the exact search to be matched somewhere in the string, even in the middle of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge.

Specifying "true" will use a fuzzy full text search anywhere in the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge and bear and mybear and myboar.

Specifying "false" will force an exact search only starting at the beginning of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge but not mybarge and not boar.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Searchable" to True'); Parameter('Searchable');

sci:arg.name: ProtocolAutoLayout
sci:arg.sci:help: Protocol AutoLayout

sci:arg.name: ComponentRevision
sci:arg.sci:help: Component Revision

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Used to select one or more items from a list, to be passed to the work protocol. Single or multi-select can be set. If multiple values are selected, they are passed as an array.
This component accepts both regular data records and array data. If multiple records with array data are received, a list box for each data record will be created.
You can set the number of rows to be displayed. If the number of rows is less than the number of values to be displayed, then a vertical scroll bar is automatically added. To create a drop-down list, set the number of rows to be displayed to 1.
Records passing out of any unconnected pass ports of components inside the subprotocol
Records passing out of any unconnected fail ports of components inside the subprotocol

sci:arg.sci:value:
Grids divide horizontal space into indivisible units called "columns". All columns in a grid must specify their width as proportion of the total available row width.

Pipe the output of one or more Column components into a Row component.

Semantic's default theme uses 16 columns.

sci:arg.name: DelimitedText
sci:arg.sci:help: The contents of a delimited text file. This is a way to include a delimited text file in a protocol without sending an additional file.

sci:arg.name: Delimiter
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifies the character that separates fields. Options include:
- FigureOut: Determines the type automatically. - Tab: For tab-delimited fields. - Space: For space-delimited fields. - Comma: For comma-delimited fields. - Colon: For colon-delimited fields. - Semicolon: For semicolon-delimited fields.

sci:arg.name: MultipleValueDelimiter
sci:arg.sci:help: The delimiter to use between multiple values contained in a single property. If the multiple value delimited exists in any of the input strings in any property, they are separated into an array of values. If "None", values are never separated into multiple values.

sci:arg.name: HasColumnNames
sci:arg.sci:help: When True, property names are taken from the first line of data in the file. When False, properties are named Column1,Column2, etc.

sci:arg.name: Tempfiles
sci:arg.sci:help: Lists the set of temporary files which will be converted by the network to true temporary file names

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value: Read Delimited Text kept with this component as a parameter value

This can be useful when you wish to send someone an example with the data contained with the protocol in a readable format. Just open the delimited file with a text viewer such as Notepad, copy the contents, and paste it into the DelimitedText parameter. Note that this component will be deprecated in the future -- you should use the right-click context Initialize Using option Provided Content on the Source parameter of the Delimited Text Reader.

As a rough guide, performance can be improved when each individual batch requires at least 10 seconds to execute, although this can be affected by the size of each data record.

When running the protocol with debugging, the subprotocol will provide debugging messages to detail each of the various steps of execution. Also, components located within the parallel subprotocol will display their debugging messages as well.

For more information on the parallel subprotocol options, see Parallel Processing Subprotocols.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Batch Size
sci:arg.sci:help:
The number of records to send to the remote server(s) for each subprotocol execution. In general, performance is optimized when the amount of time required to process each batch is at least 10 seconds (note that this can vary depending on the characteristics of the remote server's hardware). Use a batch size of -1 to pass all data in a single batch.

When RunToCompletion is set to "True - for each category", the batch sizes will be determined by the number of records in each individual category. Therefore, the Batch Size parameter is not applicable.

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server
sci:arg.sci:help:
Comma separated list of Pipeline Pilot servers on which to execute the parallel subprotocol. The server names should be in the same format as the Pipeline Pilot Client's change server dialog (server-name:port-number).

Specifying localhost as a server will cause the subprotocol to use its own Pipeline Pilot server. This can be helpful on multi-CPU/multi-core systems (where the subprotocol jobs are spawned on the same machine) and Pipeline Pilot Linux clusters (where 'localhost' requests spawning the subprotocol jobs on the same cluster).
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails('This parameter is required.'); Parameter() ne '';
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Processes
sci:arg.sci:help: Comma separated list of maximum number of batches that can be simultaneously executed on each remote server. The number of entries in this parameter must equal the number of servers. If '*' is specified as the number of processes, then that server will only launch as many batches as the administrator of the remote server has permitted.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid
sci:arg.sci:help: Run subprotocol on grid engine if available.
sci:arg.sci:member: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid Queue Name
sci:arg.sci:help: Select the queue name on the grid to submit jobs to. Leave blank to use default queue name.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: parameter('Parallel Processing Options Server Run On Grid');

sci:arg.name: Parallel Processing Options Preserve Order
sci:arg.sci:help: Whether to preserve the order of the data as it enters and leaves the remote subprotocol.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails("This parameter is only applicable if 'Parallel Processing Options' is 'True'"); Parameter('Parallel Processing Options');

sci:arg.name: Constant GUID
sci:arg.sci:help:
Override an automatically set GUID inside the component with this value.

If set, HTML element(s) will have their IDs set using this value instead of a randomly generated one.

Spaces or special characters are not allowed, only alphanumeric. The ID is case-sensitive.
sci:arg.sci:validscript: SetInvalidDetails(ParameterName() . ' must be alphanumeric. Spaces or special characters are not allowed.'); numValues(rMatch(Parameter(), '[^a-zA-Z0-9]+', 'ig')) == 0;

sci:arg.name: Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup displays additional information in a temporary message.

sci:arg.name: Popup Content
sci:arg.sci:help: Popup content. (HTML is allowed).

sci:arg.name: Basic Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can provide basic or extended formatting.

sci:arg.name: Popup Width
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can be wide or very wide to allow for longer content.

sci:arg.name: Fluid Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A fluid popup will take up the entire width of its container.

sci:arg.name: Popup Size
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can vary in font size.

sci:arg.name: Flowing Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have no maximum width and continue to flow to fit its content.

sci:arg.name: Inverted Popup
sci:arg.sci:help: A popup can have its colors inverted.

sci:arg.name: Show On
sci:arg.sci:help: When to show the popup. Hover (mouseover), click, focus (when a form element such as a text box is in focus).

sci:arg.name: Full Text Search
sci:arg.sci:help:
Specifying "exact" will force the exact search to be matched somewhere in the string, even in the middle of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge.

Specifying "true" will use a fuzzy full text search anywhere in the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge and mybarge and bear and mybear and myboar.

Specifying "false" will force an exact search only starting at the beginning of the string: e.g. typing bar will match barge but not mybarge and not boar.
sci:arg.sci:enabledscript: SetDisabledDetails('To enable '.ParameterName().', set "Searchable" to True'); Parameter('Searchable');

sci:arg.name: ComponentHelp
sci:arg.sci:value:
Used to select one or more items from a list, to be passed to the work protocol. Single or multi-select can be set. If multiple values are selected, they are passed as an array.
This component accepts both regular data records and array data. If multiple records with array data are received, a list box for each data record will be created.
You can set the number of rows to be displayed. If the number of rows is less than the number of values to be displayed, then a vertical scroll bar is automatically added. To create a drop-down list, set the number of rows to be displayed to 1.
